intro: Trasus hostianus, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the evening. Its berries are toxic and contain alkaloids, making it a plant with both ecological and medicinal significance. Trasus hostianus often grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
